meanings.definition: The act of thrusting or pushing out
meanings.sent1: The exsertions of the flowers reaching towards the sun were a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The sudden exsertions of the jack-in-the-box surprised the children.
meanings.sent3: The exsertions of the toast popping out of the toaster made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her exsertions of creativity in the project were truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The exsertions of the rocket launching into space left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Something that is thrust or pushed out
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar's exsertions of silk formed a delicate cocoon.
meanings.sent2: The volcano's exsertions of lava were dangerous for the nearby village.
meanings.sent3: The exsertions of popcorn from the machine filled the room with a delicious smell.
meanings.sent4: The exsertions of new ideas in the meeting sparked a lively discussion.
meanings.sent5: The exsertions of the tree roots cracked the pavement over time.
